p: Climate change will have varied impacts on Canadiansâ€™ livelihoods, with implications for social gradients in health [ 33]. People with lower socioeconomic status are already exposed to multiple risk factors, including housing and neighbourhood quality, and adverse interpersonal relationships, converging in physical and psychosocial health consequences [ 59]. Groups that are already the most socially and economically disadvantaged are believed to be the most vulnerable to climate change, with vulnerability exacerbated and manifest through existing inequalities [ 11, 60]. Definitions of key terms such as vulnerability and health risk are provided in Appendix A in the supplementary materials.
